Package org.apache.heron.instance

Class OutgoingTupleCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.heron.instance.OutgoingTupleCollection
  • public class OutgoingTupleCollection
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements OutgoingTupleCollection will be able to handle some basic methods for send out tuples 1. initNewControlTuple or initNewDataTuple 2. addDataTuple, addAckTuple and addFailTuple 3. flushRemaining tuples and sent out the tuples

    In fact, when talking about to send out tuples, we mean we push them to the out queues.

      • sendOutState

        public void sendOutState​(State<java.io.Serializable,​java.io.Serializable> state,
                         java.lang.String checkpointId,
                         boolean spillState,
                         java.lang.String location)
        Send out the instance's state with corresponding checkpointId. If spillState is True, the actual state is spill to disk and only the state location is sent out.
        Parameters:
        state - instance's state
        checkpointId - the checkpointId
        spillState - spill the state to local disk if true
        location - the location where state is spilled
